header.title: Supply
header.category: New Thought; Mental Science; Practical Metaphysics

central_thesis: The universe is a source of infinite and abundant supply (God/Creative Spirit) that is inherent within every individual. Lack is an illusion caused by ignorance of this truth and the failure to consciously believe, expect, and act in alignment with one's intrinsic connection to this Universal Supply, which can be manifested through specific mental and meditative practices.

structure_content.summary: Establishes universal human discontent with current provision, positing an inherent desire for greater being and acquisition, and introducing the promise of a revealed 'Way' to abundance.

structure_content.chapter_title: 1. CAN WE FIND WHAT WE TRULY DESIRE?
structure_content.summary: Asserts the individual's capacity to overcome personal lack through self-effort and learning 'The Way,' identifying 'Universal Supply' as the singular, abundant source for all needs.

Articulates God as the Creative Spirit, demonstrably omnipresent, omniscient, and omnipotent within Nature, which perpetually exhibits 'Superabundance of Supply' through its perfect, intelligent, and inexhaustible processes.

Extends the Universal Supply principle to the personal realm, affirming the individual as a microcosm of the Whole, inherently possessing all supply, with lack stemming from a failure to consciously 'USE' this intrinsic resource, exemplified by the 'Breath of Life'.

Prescribes three foundational mental attitudes for manifestation: comprehending Universal Supply's truth, internalizing one's immersion in this 'Sea of Supply,' and maintaining unwavering expectation of its arrival through the power of thought.

Details a structured five-step meditative practice: entering stillness, affirming openness to guidance, cultivating gratitude and awareness of life's oneness, visualizing the breath as a conduit for supply, and repeatedly declaring one's inherent abundance and connection to the infinite source.

Provides biographical context for Edwin J. Dingle, highlighting his background in Eastern studies and positioning Mentalphysics as a synthesis of ancient spiritual wisdom with modern scientific thought for self-development.

key_concepts.definition: The inherent, abundant, and inexhaustible resource of all good (money, health, joy, peace, etc.) available from the universe. It is not something to be acquired, but something already possessed and to be used.

God, the Creative Spirit, or the Principle of Nature, which is omniscient, omnipresent, and omnipotent. It is the perfect, superabundant source from which all life and substance emanate, always flowing.

The manifestation of Universal Supply within each person, accessible by recognizing one's inherent connection to it. Each individual is a 'magnet' for their own supply, and lack arises from not understanding or utilizing this intrinsic power.

The intelligent, active, and substance-providing force within God and Nature that 'knows how to do all things' and perpetually brings all living things into being, reflecting omnipotence, omniscience, and omnipresence.

The 'Science of Mentalphysics,' founded by Dingle, which unifies spiritual wisdom and scientific principles. It is a system for self-development aimed at leading a student to perfection of body, mind, and spirit through conscious control of their intrinsic supply.

The method or practical path of consciously aligning one's mind, belief, and actions with the truth of Universal and Individual Supply to manifest desired outcomes. It involves belief, expectation, gratitude, and specific meditative declarations.
The foundational principle for accessing Individual Supply. One must 'BELIEVE that you have it' for abundance to flow; doubt and ignorance of this truth are the primary causes of lack.
A crucial mental attitude for manifestation. One must 'EXPECT SUPPLY TO COME' without doubt, actively opening the channels for its inflow and preventing self-imposed blockages.

practical_system.description: The practical system involves a five-step meditative and affirmative ritual designed to align the practitioner's consciousness with the Universal Supply, thereby drawing desired outcomes into their life. It emphasizes stillness, gratitude, visualization, and powerful verbal declarations to internalize the truth of inherent abundance and actively 'think supply' into being. The process cultivates a state of mind characterized by belief, expectation, and a feeling of already possessing the desired supply, rather than praying for it.
tools: A quiet space conducive to stillness and concentration.
The practitioner's own breath and mind (as instruments for visualization, focused thought, and verbal declaration).
The booklet 'Supply' itself, serving as a script and guide for the specific declarations and mental exercises.
rituals: Preparation & Stillness: Sit comfortably, be still, close eyes, spine straight. Cultivate a 'deep reverential attitude' and prepare the mind.
Affirmation of Openness: Verbally declare, reverently and calmly, 'I AM NOW BEING SHOWN THE WAY... THE DOORS OF MY MIND ARE NOW OPEN THAT I MAY SEE THE WAY,' believing in its truth.

Gratitude & Oneness Meditation: Still the mind, achieve deep peace and happiness, express 'Give Thanks.' Dwell upon the 'Oneness of Life,' sensing connection to the 'Eternal Whole' and 'RHYTHM of Universal Life' through one's breath.

Supply Visualization & Declaration: Imagine the breath as a water-wheel drawing from the 'Great Source of Supply.' Experience a physical sensation ('Heavy' or 'Light') indicating immersion in the Universal Whole. Then declare: 'I DRAW MY SUPPLY FROM THE SOURCE OF INFINITE SUPPLY... I AM WHOLE AS THOU, THE LORD OF ALL SUPPLY, ART WHOLE,' contemplating its completeness.

Further Declarations & Contemplation: Continue with specific affirmations of inherent abundance ('I AM ABUNDANCE AS THOU'), courage, power, and gratitude for the revealed truth. Pledge to use supply liberally, giving 'ten per cent' to its source, and conclude with powerful declarations of freedom from lack and the present manifestation of all desired supply.

relevant_quotes.text: YOU ALREADY HAVE ALL THAT THERE IS IN THE UNIVERSE you have to 'Believe That Ye Have It', and then TRAIN YOURSELF TO USE IT that's all. THAT is the secret of all Supply. WE HAVE IT. The reason that we think we still have to GET it is that we DO NOT USE IT.
YOUR SOURCE OF SUPPLY IS WITHIN YOU. YOU and YOU ALONE are the magnet which attracts to yourself everything that is necessary to make a perfect life.
The complete study of Mentalphysics leads a student to perfection of body, mind, and spirit, through his own self-development.
by the obedience by YOU of Nature's Laws, the abundance of Nature will flow to you according as you BELIEVE THAT YE HAVE IT.
As a man thinketh in his heart, so IS HE.
I am now taking a definite step in the developmental process of my Higher Consciousness, and am finding my way to the True Goal of My SUPPLY.

My very Breath is Universal in its supply - I gain my Breath from the Infinite Supply of the Breath of the Universe. It is just the same with money, with joy, with love, with health, with peace, and ALL POSSIBLE CONCEIVABLE SUPPLY - all that I possibly can take is Mine, Mine for Evermore.

I pledge myself that, as My Supply Flows to Me, I will let it flow outward to others unimpeded. I am liberal-handed to others who have less than I have. I pledge myself that I will give ten per cent of all that flows to me to that Source whence this knowledge comes to me.

critical_analysis.relevance: Dingle's 'Supply' is a quintessential text within the early 20th-century New Thought movement, presenting a practical application of metaphysical principles for abundance. It asserts an internal locus of control, aligning with Hermetic concepts of 'As Above, So Below' and the creative power of consciousness. The concept of 'Universal Supply' as an immanent, ever-present divine resource parallels esoteric doctrines of Akasha or the inherent plentitude of the divine. The structured practice of affirmations, visualization, and focused intention, while characteristic of New Thought, also echoes ceremonial magic's use of specific verbal formulae and mental discipline for manifestation. The explicit recommendation to 'give ten per cent' reflects ancient esoteric principles of tithing or energetic reciprocity, ensuring continuous flow. Dingleâ€™s background with a 'Tibetan teacher' suggests an attempted synthesis of Eastern spiritual philosophy with Western metaphysical practicalities, broadening its esoteric scope.
critical_analysis.target_audience: Individuals seeking practical methods for self-improvement and material/spiritual abundance, particularly those disillusioned with traditional supplication-based prayer. It is geared towards self-starters interested in mental science, New Thought, or metaphysical spirituality who are willing to engage in structured meditative and affirmative practices. It would appeal to those who believe in an immanent divine force and the power of conscious thought to shape reality, and who seek a structured system for applying these beliefs to practical life challenges through conscious and directed mental work rather than external intervention.
